intro: Pouzolzia boiviniana, commonly known as the Boivin's pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Pouzolzia boiviniana is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
